snippet.title: Armstrong teammate Hincapie pens stark memoir
snippet.description: George Hincapie was the "Loyal Lieutenant" who helped Lance Armstrong to seven Tour de France titles, only to later provide the key testimony that brought his downfall.

snippet.title: Homeland Security puts former inspector general on administrative leave
snippet.description: Move comes after investigation finds former watchdog had tailored reports to the liking of White House officials.

snippet.title: Jury urges death sentence for ex-Marine convicted of strangling fellow service member
snippet.description: They must decide unanimously whether Jorge Torrez deserves execution for 2009 killing.

snippet.title: Thou Shalt Not Covet Thy Neighbor's Approval Ratings
snippet.description: Short term jumps in approval ratings cannot necessarily be converted into political capital.

snippet.title: Christie says he would have stopped lane closings
snippet.description: New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie said Thursday he would have stopped aides from blocking lanes to the George Washington Bridge last fall if he had known about the plan in advance, saying outright what he has implied in previous denials about the traffic jam scandal that's engulfed his administration.

snippet.title: Tiny Pacific nation sues 9 nuclear-armed powers
snippet.description: The tiny Pacific nation of the Marshall Islands is taking on the United States and the world's eight other nuclear-armed nations with an unprecedented lawsuit demanding that they meet their obligations toward disarmament and accusing them of "flagrant violations" of international law.

snippet.title: Who is the NHL's best defensive forward: Jonathan Toews, Patrice Bergeron or Anze Kopitar?
snippet.description: The three are in the running for the Selke Award

snippet.title: FDA eases into regulating e-cigarettes
snippet.description: The federal government's move to regulate e-cigarettes is a leap into the unknown.

snippet.title: Families of ferry's lost confront SKorea officials
snippet.description: Angry relatives of some of the more than 120 people still missing from the sinking of the ferry Sewol surrounded the fisheries minister and the coast guard chief Thursday, preventing them from leaving the area where families have been waiting for word of their loved ones for more than a week.

snippet.title: Why first lady Michelle Obama changed the date of commencement speech
snippet.description: First lady alters date of graduation speech in Kansas to alleviate concerns from families over tickets
